title: 4 bedroom detached house for sale
address: Meadow View, Redbourn, St Albans, Hertfordshire
key_features: Southerly Facing Garden with Far Reaching Views
full_description: **VIDEO TOUR AVAILABLE** A fabulous four bedroom detached home of exceptional quality set in this delightful private development with far reaching views across open countryside.  **VIDEO TOUR AVAILABLE** This exceptional property offers well thought out and spacious accommodation.  A particular feature of this property is the floor to ceiling windows in both the main reception room and master bedroom which flood the property with natural light. An attractive entrance hall with tiled floor leads into the living room with feature fireplace.  To the rear the property boasts a superb fitted kitchen/dining room which extends across the back of the property with two sets of patio doors leading out to the garden.  The kitchen is fully fitted with stylish cream units, granite work surfaces and integrated appliances including an AEG range style cooker and microwave.  A separate utility room sits just off.  In addition there is also a useful office space and guest cloakroom on this level. Upstairs the property has four bedrooms most of which have lovely views with both the guest bedroom and master bedroom having en-suite facilities. An additional family bathroom serves the remaining bedrooms.  Outside the property has a secluded rear garden with glorious views across open countryside, the garden is mainly laid to lawn with a patio seating area adjacent to the rear of the house.  At the front of the property there is a pretty landscaped front garden and to the side a paved driveway provides parking for several vehicles and leads to a garage with up and over door.  **VIDEO TOUR AVAILABLE** Meadow view is an exclusive gated development set in 9 acres of landscaped grounds, located just outside Redbourn, a picturesque village in Hertfordshire. The property is within easy reach of excellent transport links including the M1 and M25 motorways and London Luton Airport, fast rail links and wider amenities are located in nearby Harpenden and the historic City of St. Albans.

sold_details.address: Oaklands Lodge, 12, Meadow View, Redbourn, St. Albans, Hertfordshire AL3 7QQ

full_description: CHECK-OUT THE VIDEO TOUR! A charming bay fronted three bedroom character property, situated in a wonderful central location, close to Aboyne Lodge School and within walking distance of the mainline station to London St Pancras. This spacious home provides many features typical of its era, to include sash windows throughout and fireplaces in the living room and rear reception room.  Of further benefit is a superb, fully-enclosed south-facing garden. Planning has been granted to substantially enlarge the property. Please see St Albans DC Planning application 5/2019/2510. The property briefly comprises: entrance porch, entrance hall, living room, rear reception room, dining area, kitchen, landing, three bedrooms and a luxury first floor bathroom.  South-facing rear garden. Offered for sale Chain Free.

title: 4 bedroom detached house for sale

full_description: Stunning extended four bedroom detached family home in the popular village of Redbourn. The property has been refurbished to a very high standard. Offered chain free. This stunning extended and refurbished 4 bedroom detached family home. Offering excellent accommodation throughout with fantastic kitchen/diner and bi fold doors overlooking the rear garden, a utility room, downstairs cloakroom, study and lounge. Upstairs two of the bedrooms have en suites and a further 2 bedrooms and family bathroom complete this home. Outside is a large driveway for off road parking and a landscaped beautiful rear garden. The village's extensive amenities are all within a short walk and include the High Street which offers a range of shops from Post Office to independent shops. The Health Centre is also close by and the village has an excellent primary school. More extensive shopping and leisure facilities are a short drive away in both Harpenden and the historic city of St Albans. The village is favoured with excellent transport links with Junction 9 of the M1 close by and Thameslink rail services available at both Harpenden and St Albans. London Luton Airport is also nearby.  Door to front. Double glazed window to front. Under floor Heating.  Wash hand basin and low level WC. Under floor heating. 8' 10" x 7' 2" ( 2.69m x 2.18m ) Double glazed window to side. Under floor heating. 19' 1" x 11' 9" ( 5.82m x 3.58m ) Double glazed window to front and side. Under floor heating. 24' 11" x 18' 11" ( 7.59m x 5.77m ) Stunning fitted kitchen with wall and base units. Kitchen island. Quartz work tops. Sink. Integrated dishwasher. Wine cooler, Under floor heating. Large dining \ lounge area. Bi fold doors to rear garden.  Wall and base units. Cupboards. Sink and drainer. Boiler. Under floor heating.  Stairs from hall. Cupboard. Loft access. Double glazed window to front. 11' 9" x 11' 6" ( 3.58m x 3.51m ) Built in wardrobes. Radiator. Double glazed windows to front and side.  Shower cubicle, wash hand basin and low level WC. Radiator. Under floor heating. 14' 9" x 11' 11" ( 4.50m x 3.63m ) Radiator. Built in wardrobes. Double glazed window to rear.  Shower cubicle, wash hand basin and low level WC. Under floor heating. 12' 8" x 8' 4" ( 3.86m x 2.54m ) Double glazed window to rear. Radiator. 8' 4" plus recess x 6' 4" ( 2.54m plus recess x 1.93m ) Double glazed window to rear. Radiator.  Bath with mixer tap. Rainfall shower over bath, wash hand basin and low level WC. Radiator. Under floor heating.  Driveway. Landscaped borders. Side access to rear.   Patio area. Landscaped beautiful garden with new Lawn. 1. title: 2 bedroom flat for sale
agent_address: Suite 7, First Floor, Cranmore Drive, Shirley, Solihull, B90 4RZ
full_description: The Property Purplebricks is delighted to offer for sale this period 2 bedroom first floor flat. As you climb the charming wooden stairs to the first floor landing you catch the first glimpse of the uninterrupted sea views. As you stand on plush new carpeting, which is fitted throughout, and look around the elegant first floor landing, you can’t help but be captured by the beautiful original features. From its sweeping staircase with the original ornate wooden spindles to the high ceilings, deep skirting boards and original doors with their decorative door surrounds still in place. As you enter the spacious lounge you will notice the contemporary twist of the wall mounted linear amber glow effect electric fire. The window  with views over Cluny Square has decorative stain glass panels, and there is also a beautiful V-shaped window overlooking the side of the property, the room has also retained its original cornices and high skirting boards. The modern light and airy, streamlined kitchen is fitted with an ample range of wall and floor units with a feature workstation with a five ring gas hob and feature cooker hood. The oven, dishwasher, fridge and freezer are all integrated. Up stairs you will find two large bedrooms. Bedroom one is to the front of the property with a bay window overlooking the square. It is fitted with a range of wardrobes and drawer units. Bedroom two is to the rear of the property and framed through the large bay window, there is an exceptional view of the sea. The bathroom is fitted to a high standard, is fitted with an over the bath shower and is tastefully drywall lined. At the entrance to the property is a driveway. This property is highly desirable and must be viewed to be fully appreciated. To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award winning app.   Location This beautiful home is situated in Buckie on the Moray Firth and is within easy reach of all local amenities. The property is within commuting distance RAF Lossiemouth, the Army Barracks at Kinloss and only 17 miles from the Cathedral City of Elgin where additional shopping facilities are abundant. Being only one hour from Aviemore where winter sport such as skiing and hiking are favourite activities is a real bonus! This busy little town has its own large harbour and marina and number of leisure facilities including a leisure centre, two golf courses and two outdoor bowling parks. The stunning Bow Fiddle Rock can be seen near Portknockie to the north east of Buckie and the stunning beaches with spectacular long walks along the coast and abundance of wildlife add to the appeal of the area. If that isn't enough, living here will bring you closer to the famous Malt Whisky Trail. Wildlife includes dolphins, which can be seen from the beach at the mouth of Spey Bay - also a good spot for observing otters and ospreys. Long-distance footpath the Speyside Way starts (or finishes) here.  *** Note to Solicitors *** All formal offers should be emailed in the first instance to  . Should your client's offer be accepted, please then send the Principle offer directly to the seller's solicitor upon receipt of the Notification of Proposed Sale which will be emailed to you.
